elements.desc:
``<iron-form>` is an HTML `<form>` element that can validate and submit any custom
elements that implement `Polymer.IronFormElementBehavior`, as well as any
native HTML elements.

It supports both `get` and `post` methods, and uses an `iron-ajax` element to
submit the form data to the action URL.

  Example:

    <form is="iron-form" id="form" method="post" action="/form/handler">
      <paper-input name="name" label="name"></paper-input>
      <input name="address">
      ...
    </form>

By default, a native `<button>` element will submit this form. However, if you
want to submit it from a custom element's click handler, you need to explicitly
call the form's `submit` method.

  Example:

    <paper-button raised onclick="submitForm()">Submit</paper-button>

    function submitForm() {
      document.getElementById('form').submit();
    }

events.desc: Fired after the form is submitted and an error is received.

jsdoc.description: Fired after the form is submitted and an error is received.
jsdoc.orig:
*
     * Fired after the form is submitted and an error is received.
     *
     * @event iron-form-error

events.name: iron-form-error

events.desc: Fired if the form cannot be submitted because it's invalid.

jsdoc.description: Fired if the form cannot be submitted because it's invalid.
jsdoc.orig:
*
     * Fired if the form cannot be submitted because it's invalid.
     *
     * @event iron-form-invalid

events.name: iron-form-invalid

events.desc: Fired after the form is submitted and a response is received.

jsdoc.description: Fired after the form is submitted and a response is received.
jsdoc.orig:
*
    * Fired after the form is submitted and a response is received.
    *
    * @event iron-form-response

events.name: iron-form-response

events.desc: Fired after the form is submitted.

jsdoc.description: Fired after the form is submitted.
jsdoc.orig:
*
     * Fired after the form is submitted.
     *
     * @event iron-form-submit

events.name: iron-form-submit

properties.name: contentType
properties.desc: Content type to use when sending data.

properties.name: serialize
properties.desc:
Returns a json object containing name/value pairs for all the registered
custom components and native elements of the form. If there are elements
with duplicate names, then their values will get aggregated into an
array of values.

properties.name: listeners
properties.desc: Fired after the form is submitted and an error is received.

iron-form.desc:
``<iron-form>` is an HTML `<form>` element that can validate and submit any custom
elements that implement `Polymer.IronFormElementBehavior`, as well as any
native HTML elements.

It supports both `get` and `post` methods, and uses an `iron-ajax` element to
submit the form data to the action URL.

  Example:

    <form is="iron-form" id="form" method="post" action="/form/handler">
      <paper-input name="name" label="name"></paper-input>
      <input name="address">
      ...
    </form>

By default, a native `<button>` element will submit this form. However, if you
want to submit it from a custom element's click handler, you need to explicitly
call the form's `submit` method.

  Example:

    <paper-button raised onclick="submitForm()">Submit</paper-button>

    function submitForm() {
      document.getElementById('form').submit();
    }
